task.title: Configuring a Pipeline
task.shortdesc: Configure a pipeline to define the stream of data. After you configure the pipeline, you can start the pipeline.

context.p:
A pipeline can include the following components:
A single origin stage
Multiple processor stages
Multiple destination stages

step.cmd: If this is the first pipeline for the , click Create Pipeline.
step.info: If you have created other pipelines, if necessary, use the Toggle Library icon to display the Library, and click the Create New Pipeline icon.

step.cmd: In the New Pipeline window, enter a pipeline name and optional description, and click Save.
step.stepresult: The pipeline canvas displays the new name. The Properties panel displays the pipeline properties.

strow.stentry:
Determines how the handles data after an unexpected event causes the pipeline to stop running. Select one of the following options:
At least once. Ensures all data is processed and written to the destination. Might result in duplicate rows.
At most once. Ensures that data is not reprocessed to prevent writing duplicate data to the destination. Might result in missing rows.
Default is At least once.

step.cmd: Use the Stage Library icon to add an origin stage. In the Properties panel, configure the stage properties.
step.info: For configuration details about origin stages, see .

step.cmd: Use the Stage Library button to add the next stage that you want to use, connect the origin to the new stage, and configure the new stage.

step.cmd: When the pipeline is valid, you can use the Preview icon to preview data to fine-tune pipeline configuration.
When the pipeline is complete, use the Start icon to run the pipeline.

taskbody.result: The starts the pipeline. The Monitor panel displays real-time statistics for the pipeline.
